1 Peter__02.1: Wherefore laying away all malice, and all guile, and dissimulations, and envies, and all detractions,
1 Peter__02.2: As newborn babes, desire the rational milk without guile, that thereby you may grow unto salvation:
1 Peter__02.3: If so be you have tasted that the Lord is sweet.
1 Peter__02.4: Unto whom coming, as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen and made honourable by God:
1 Peter__02.5: Be you also as living stones built up, a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.
1 Peter__02.6: Wherefore it is said in the scripture: Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious. And he that shall believe in him, shall not be confounded.
1 Peter__02.7: To you therefore that believe, he is honour: but to them that believe not, the stone which the builders rejected, the same is made the head of the corner:
1 Peter__02.8: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of scandal, to them who stumble at the word, neither do believe, whereunto also they are set.
1 Peter__02.9: But you are a chosen generation, a kingly priesthood, a holy nation, a purchased people: that you may declare his virtues, who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
1 Peter__02.10: Who in time past were not a people: but are now the people of God. Who had not obtained mercy; but now have obtained mercy.
1 Peter__02.11: Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, to refrain yourselves from carnal desires which war against the soul,
1 Peter__02.12: Having your conversation good among the Gentiles: that whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by the good works, which they shall behold in you, glorify God in the day of visitation.
1 Peter__02.13: Be ye subject therefore to every human creature for God's sake: whether it be to the king as excelling;
1 Peter__02.14: Or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of the good:
1 Peter__02.15: For so is the will of God, that by doing well you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:
1 Peter__02.16: As free, and not as making liberty a cloak for malice, but as the servants of God.
1 Peter__02.17: Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.
1 Peter__02.18: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.
1 Peter__02.19: For this is thankworthy, if for conscience towards God, a man endure sorrows, suffering wrongfully.
1 Peter__02.20: For what glory is it, if committing sin, and being buffeted for it, you endure? But if doing well you suffer patiently; this is thankworthy before God.
1 Peter__02.21: For unto this are you called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving you an example that you should follow his steps.
1 Peter__02.22: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth.
1 Peter__02.23: Who, when he was reviled, did not revile: when he suffered, he threatened not: but delivered himself to him that judged him unjustly.
1 Peter__02.24: Who his own self bore our sins in his body upon the tree: that we, being dead to sins, should live to justice: by whose stripes you were healed.
1 Peter__02.25: For you were as sheep going astray; but you are now converted to the shepherd and bishop of your souls.
